description: Compare German muffeln (“grouse, grumble”) and similar German words with similar meanings such as Muff, mupf, Muffel and Dutch moppen (“growl, grouse”). Probably related to mop (“grimace”).

examples: She's taken a miff at something, I suppose, and means to cut my acquaintance.

verbs.description: miff (third-person singular simple present miffs, present participle miffing, simple past and past participle miffed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, usually used in the passive) To offend slightly.
examples: […]  answered my Thetis, a little miffed perhaps -- to use the women's phrase — that I turned the conversation upon my former partner, rather than addressed it to herself.
She miffed and started to reply, but thought better of it.
